meta.description: Plaza Premium Lounge (Gate 1) at Hong Kong International Airport (HKG), Terminal 1. Learn more about the lounge: amenities, photos, review, opening hours, location.

lounge.name: Plaza Premium Lounge (Gate 1)

location.description: Chek Lap Kok, Hong Kong, China

lounge.description: Plaza Premium Lounge’s flagship location eagerly awaits your presence. Treat yourself to a whirlwind of peace and tranquility before embarking on the next leg of your journey. Sample a diverse range of international cuisines, including the signature Hong Kong-style fish ball noodle soup and homemade XO sauce. Dazzle yourself with a revitalizing shower and soak in the cosmopolitan atmosphere.

general: Children under 2 years old are admitted free with an adult.
warning: Complimentary beer is available. Wine and spirits are available at an additional cost.

reviews.content: Need to scan code to get some hot food items. What the hell?????? What’s going on? Terrible.
Busy long line most of the time and hard to find seat.
This is a standard lounge. It is nothing special. Problem is, it is near gate 1. Everyone stops here first. Crazy busy. Hard to find seats. Hong Kong fish noodle soup was bland, close to flavorless.
An OK pit stop if you need a bite but don’t want to relax. Absolutely packed with barely a seat by 8am. OK food selection but it’s dirty and staff unfortunately don’t appear to be able to keep up.
The much more crowded PP lounge near immigration. High turnover but definitely not a quiet place to work or rest given the volume. Staff does what they can to keep it running smooth. Get a cube.
Crap food. Crap service. No thought put into anything. Sorry lounge.

Decent lounge. Not much food & beverage selections but it has the essentials (coffee, water, juice, veggies). Staff is friendly & there’s a good # of tables and outlets. Over pop. is a problem though.
This was a nice lounge. It certainly wasn’t empty, but there was sufficient seating. Food spread had both Asian and Western options. The only downside was that there was no wine or liquor, just beer.
Not a great ambience. Food spread so so.
SO MANY VEGETARIAN OPTIONS! Very strange to find this in Hong Kong. Good seating and WiFi, worth a visit.
Employees are rude/obnoxious and there’s bugs flying around... never been to an inside lounge with bugs flying around before...
Okay lounge. Some good selections. Power outlets at each chair.
Booked the shower from 6:00 am to 6:30 am, was woke up at 5:30 am with rude voice. When I went at 6:06 I was told "it is passed", not available. The service is very bad!!!
Not too busy when I visited, good choice of food and drink and was able to book shower!
Came here on a Tuesday afternoon and the lounge was packed. Was able to find seating though. Not as many food options as the West lounge and the space is a lot smaller and crowd rowdier.
Very busy! Long lines for food and people fighting for spaces to sit.
Only 2 showers available and not being cleared that needed to be booked. Very crowded and not able to relax at all. Queue for food and noisy....better off to gate 60 which is a shower lounge.
The lounge is very busy due to location - I flew out on Friday morning - the staff works hard to keep up with demand. I didn’t feel like walking & the shower was available which is normally a wait.
Definitely not relaxing considering you're fighting off hoards of people pushing and shoving for food...OK it's not that bad. People actually formed a line at one point. Free beer. OK food.
Uncomfortable, super crowded and not appealing at all.
Overnight layover so bought 6-hour pass. At 1:30am the staff started cleaning, making everyone get up from their naps & stand around for about an hour. Couldn’t this have been done in the morning?
Fantastic in every way. Great food with many hot options. Excellent drinks selection. Lots of different snack options, too. Plenty of seating, offering great comfort. Refreshing and clean showers.
Now in the lounge, we appreciate the dark quiet atmosphere with soothing generic Muzak. The chairs are worn and anything more than warm can beer costs money. But the local dim sum food is quite good!
Zero selection of booze bar yep draft beers. Not a good place to relax with a stiff pre-flight whiskey!
A comfortable place to relax and enjoy the fishball noodle soup before your flight. The lounge is dimly lit, so the atmosphere is better than photos would suggest.
Good food and drink selection....showers available if interested ...I said no and based on that I have another hour I can stay in here.
Worth a visit. Too busy on Jan 2 2017; much less so on Jan 7th. Nice, limited selection of food. Very tasty bread pudding. Draft Carlsberg beer and 3 can beer options.
Inferior Plaza Premium lounge just after security, so always yawning with people. Decent amenities and food but head to Gate 40 (short walk) for much better option.
No windows. Usually quite noisy with lots of people. Food and drink options are good. A quiet zone would be nice.
Perfectly acceptable lounge, decent hot food options and OK snack and drink choices, no wine available though. Head past the dining area for a quieter seating area.
Very crowded place, cold food. Limited choices.
Nice lounge - can get a little crowded but decent free things. Definitely not a real "premium" lounge like some of the others.
West Hall had a big queue outside on a Saturday morning. Headed to this one. Nice and quiet and out of the way. Comfy seat area was closed off. Not obvious why this was.
Great lounge with a separate area for business airline passengers. There is a joke food station and great ambience.
The seating area for eating, it's not enough, they should open the area that is "always closed"!
Was told shower will be ready in 30 min but because our boarding is 90 mins away, they waited until almost 60 minutes til boarding to let me use it. Nobody in there it was empty. Service is horrible.
A fine lounge but not comparable to the many fine Cathay lounges at HK if you have access.
Really a very solid lounge in the top 20% of all lounges I've seen. Perhaps a little unappreciated due to all the Cathay options nearby. However, it was great to use at 3 am when Cathay was closed.
A bit dark and somewhat crowded but with a clean feel and very quiet.
Only 1 shower. At 630am, first available shower at 9.
Really nice and big, nice food.
Wow, this lounge is definitely one of the best I've been to, ranking up there with the American Express Centurion lounges.
Very crowded but high quality lounge. Decent food and everything is being cleaned constantly, including your table as you finish.
Visited again. Just slept here for a few hours before CX Wing First Class opened. Comfy and the staff didn't mind.
Very busy. Had to queue to get in. Only free basic beer, no free wine.
The best part of this lounge is the food. Try fish ball noodle! The dessert here is also worth a try. The lounge is very busy and do not expect much of service from the staff.
It was an overcrowded lounge with hardly any place to sit. The showers were not working. However the wifi seems good and the food was alright.
My go to lounge with hot noodles, no noodles in the morning so keep that in mind, otherwise very crowded!
A good lounge to go to if you don't have elite status. It has nice showers and a decent selection of food and drinks. Not worth a detour, but a good place to be instead of sitting next to the gate.
Typically very crowded and hard to find a seat. Nice food options. Only one free drink then have to pay. Free seated massage is nice.
Was worried after reading a few reviews, but I thought the lounge was great. Came early for a morning flight. Noodle bar was great, wifi was speedy, and service was good enough.
Lounge was absolutely packed, servers were rude, bartender didn't know common drinks and food was cold. Would definitely not visit again.
Flew JAL business and they actually have a separate section for it inside the lounge with its own shower, restroom and Japanese food and beers.
Always packed but food isn't bad. They are pretty lax on allowing guests.
A large crowded lounge, always busy due to number of people who have access via credit cards. At peak times it's better to go grab food & drink then go back outside to sit, as I have done so before.
Beer is free, pay for wine and spirits. Crowded at 7pm. Staff were very pleasant.
I paid for 5 hour entry (about $65 US). The lounge is very crowded, food looked good. My fee included a 10 min neck and shoulder massage which was excellent and a shower. Great wifi, 1 drink coupon.
This lounge is very, very crowded. We tried to use it twice in the last week. One time, every seat in the lounge was full. The second time, there was a long line outside the lounge waiting to get in.
Yes, it's crowded, but good food and drink selection.  You'll find a seat, don't worry.  Overall a great lounge to grab a drink and snack, but maybe not for business.
Dark lounge that was much more crowded than the West one.  Food was ok, but also below West.
Good snack selection but extremely overcrowded and they really need to pay attention to the overall cleanliness of the lounge and the restrooms!
4pm Saturday: 50% full, amazing food and drinks. Very well presented : ) Massages seem cheap too : )

This was a great lounge for me when my first flight got in early at 4:45 AM and CX lounges weren't open yet. Had a soda and some snacks in the very comfortable seats. Could easily fall asleep in dark.
Nice lounge. Clean showers. Good food selection. Can get crowded. Does not announce or track flights.
Small but nice, gets busy & crowded during peak times, but good food and drink choices. Perhaps not the most relaxing lounge, but still very nice.
Almost always busy, especially close to peak departure hours. Sometimes, it's hard to find a seat. However, the hot food selection is good.
The WiFi here is fast, and there's a food station with a nice selection. The bar, for which I received a free voucher for one drink, is also nice. You can also pay for massages, etc.
